title: How is a research article different from an ordinary article? - Quora

response.answer_text: A research article is a specific category of academic/scientific paper (=article). Research articles are defined by the fact that they contain new data or information. For instance that 48 of 50 people recovered from covid after taking high dose vitamin C. This contrasts with a review paper which puts together results of several such research papers and doesn’t have any new data of its own.

Think of a Research Article, e.g., as an explication of a Life Insurance Policy or a Court Brief. You’re hacking through the self-serving miasma of each: These subjects are ours only, never be to understood by mere plebeians. An ordinary article in none of that.
